issue.title: insert iterators inefficient for expensive to move types

discussion.p: The new concepts for the insert iterators mandate an extra copy when inserting an lvalue:
The reason is to convert value into an rvalue because the current BackInsertionContainer concept only handles push_back-ing rvalues:
Without the conversion of value to an rvalue, the assignment operator fails to concept check.
A solution is to modify the BackInsertionContainer concept so that the client can pass in the parameter type for push_back similar to what is already done for the OutputIterator concept:
This allows the assignment operator to be adjusted appropriately:

blockquote.pre: requires BackInsertionContainer<Cont, Cont::value_type const&amp> && CopyConstructible<Cont::value_type> back_insert_iterator<Cont>& operator=(const Cont::value_type& value);

discussion.note: We may want to propagate this fix to other concepts such as StackLikeContainer.
Solution and wording collaborated on by Doug and Howard.

blockquote.p: Howard notes that "these operations behaved efficiently until concepts were added."
Alisdair is uncertain that the proposed resolution is syntactically correct.
Move to Open, and recommend the issue be deferred until after the next Committee Draft is issued.

discussion.blockquote: NAD, solved by the removal of concepts.

blockquote.pre: template <BackInsertionContainer Cont> class back_insert_iterator { ... requires BackInsertionContainer<Cont, const Cont::value_type&> CopyConstructible<Cont::value_type> back_insert_iterator<Cont>& operator=(const Cont::value_type& value); ...
requires BackInsertionContainer<Cont, const Cont::value_type&> CopyConstructible<Cont::value_type> back_insert_iterator<Cont>& operator=(const Cont::value_type& value);

template <FrontInsertionContainer Cont> class front_insert_iterator { ... requires FrontInsertionContainer<Cont, const Cont::value_type&> CopyConstructible<Cont::value_type> front_insert_iterator<Cont>& operator=(const Cont::value_type& value); ...
requires FrontInsertionContainer<Cont, const Cont::value_type&> CopyConstructible<Cont::value_type> front_insert_iterator<Cont>& operator=(const Cont::value_type& value);

template <InsertionContainer Cont> class insert_iterator { ... requires InsertionContainer<Cont, const Cont::value_type&> CopyConstructible<Cont::value_type> insert_iterator<Cont>& operator=(const Cont::value_type& value); ...
requires InsertionContainer<Cont, const Cont::value_type&> CopyConstructible<Cont::value_type> insert_iterator<Cont>& operator=(const Cont::value_type& value);
iter = insert(*container, iter, Cont::value_type(value)); ++iter;
